content.raw: I think that was just timing, the default job ran before some of the pre-reases were available. I'm started a new one and it's picking up the pres: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=75)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64/75/)
content.html: I think that was just timing, the default job ran before some of the pre-reases were available. I'm started a new one and it's picking up the pres:

content.raw:
So, after some offline conversation with @azeey 

1. We have to drop the `noexcept` in the move constructor declaration in case the `DataType` move constructor isn't marked `noexcept`, in which case the compiler will generate a definition that doesn’t match the declaration.
2. We can't drop all of these because we have `DataType` forward-declared in some places, which will cause compiler errors and run-time issues. I think that this would be eventually nice to have, but outside of the scope of this PR.
content.html:
So, after some offline conversation with @azeey

  1. We have to drop the noexcept in the move constructor declaration in case the DataType move constructor isn't marked noexcept, in which case the compiler will generate a definition that doesn’t match the declaration.
  2. We can't drop all of these because we have DataType forward-declared in some places, which will cause compiler errors and run-time issues. I think that this would be eventually nice to have, but outside of the scope of this PR.

content.raw: Well, unless I read your already-written comment about that above.
content.html: Well, unless I read your already-written comment about that above.

content.raw: Upon further though, it  seems like all of these could be dropped now that the class should be trivial.
content.html: Upon further though, it seems like all of these could be dropped now that the class should be trivial.

content.raw: What's the reason for dropping `noexcept` here? I thought that it was generally a good idea to have it \(ref: [https://akrzemi1.wordpress.com/2015/09/11/declaring-the-move-constructor/](https://akrzemi1.wordpress.com/2015/09/11/declaring-the-move-constructor)\)
content.html: What's the reason for dropping noexcept here? I thought that it was generally a good idea to have it (ref: https://akrzemi1.wordpress.com/2015/09/11/declaring-the-move-constructor/)

content.raw: There are a bunch of test failures on Jenkins, but CI has been changing so quickly lately that it may not be this PR's fault. Worth taking a look to figure out the root cause. The tests are [not failing on default](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64/74/).
content.html: There are a bunch of test failures on Jenkins, but CI has been changing so quickly lately that it may not be this PR's fault. Worth taking a look to figure out the root cause. The tests are not failing on default.

content.raw: We could change pipelines to use `ign-sensors2` nightlies and that may solve the dependency issues
content.html: We could change pipelines to use ign-sensors2 nightlies and that may solve the dependency issues

content.raw: Nice! Thanks for the example :slight_smile:
content.html: Nice! Thanks for the example

content.raw: Removed the nexcept in b62381c. I checked with a [simple example](https://repl.it/repls/DimpledScalyEngine) and the noexcept seems to be calculated automatically when doing `=default`.
content.html: Removed the nexcept in b62381c. I checked with a simple example and the noexcept seems to be calculated automatically when doing =default.

update.description: Avoids heap allocation and ensures that the `data` members of each `Component` are stored in contiguous memory.
update.title: [Blueprint] Remove PIMPL from Component

content.raw:
Clang doesn't like the default move constructors:

~~~
/home/developer/ws/src/ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Component.hh:332:24: error: exception specification of explicitly defaulted move assignment operator does not match the calculated one
    public: Component &operator=(Component &&_component) noexcept = default;
                       ^
~~~
content.html:
Clang doesn't like the default move constructors:

/home/developer/ws/src/ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Component.hh:332:24: error: exception specification of explicitly defaulted move assignment operator does not match the calculated one
    public: Component &operator=(Component &&_component) noexcept = default;
                       ^
